vortex

Class GameDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • vortex.GameDriver

  • public abstract class GameDriver
extends java.lang.Object
    This class serves as the driver of the Game class. This is the class that will be inherited to create your game. Contains a static GameDriver object called gameDriver that will be used as the child for the Game class.

    Example of how to create GameDriver using TestGame as inheriting class:

    public class TestGame extends GameDriver{
      public static void main(String[] args){
        gameDriver = new TestGame();
        Game.initGame('title');
        Game.setChild(gameDriver);
        Game.start();
      }
    }

    Note: This is just a template. You will likely need to call some other functions in the Game class to set the size of the window and other properties. Also, you will be prompted to override the 3 abstract functions:
    public abstract void init(GameContainer gc);
    public abstract void render(GameContainer gc, Graphics g);
    public abstract void update(GameContainer gc, int i);
    These allow you initialize things before the game loop starts as well as render and update them.

    Author:
    Daniel Stumpff

      • init

        public abstract void init(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer gc)

        Parameters:

      • update

        public abstract void update(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer gc,
                            int i)
        Called continuously while game is running. Updates objects each frame.
        Parameters:
        gc - The GameContainer used by this class
        i - The amount of time that's passed since last update in milliseconds

      • render

        public abstract void render(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer gc,
                            org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g)
        Called continuously while game is running. Draws object to the game window.
        Parameters:

        g - The Graphics used by this class

        public void mouseMoved(int oldx,
                       int oldy,
                       int newx,
                       int newy)
        Called when the mouse is moved.
        Parameters:
        oldx - The position of the mouse's previous x.
        oldy - The position of the mouse's previous y.
        newx - The new position of the mouse's x.
        newy - The new position of the mouse's y.
